programme.title: The Life With Larry Mazza
programme.desc: Larry Mazza interviews Bill Cutolo Jr., the son of slain Colombo capo William "Wild Bill" Cutolo and self-proclaimed motivational speaker who has appeared in Mafia documentaries.

programme.title: The Life With Larry Mazza
programme.desc: Larry Mazza interviews Michael F. Dowd, a former New York City Police Department corrupt officer, drug distributor and criminal associate of the Diaz organization, who was arrested in 1992 for running a drug ring out of Suffolk County, Long Island.

programme.title: The Life With Larry Mazza
programme.desc: Former Colombo crime family enforcer Larry Mazza interviews actor Craig DiFrancia, whose credits include "The Irishman," "Brothers by Blood," "Power," "Green Book" and "Blue Bloods."

programme.title: The Life With Larry Mazza
programme.desc: Larry Mazza interviews Bobby Luisi Jr., son of Robert C. Luisi Sr., a one-time enforcer of the Boston faction of the Patriarca crime family, who followed his father's lifestyle and became a caporegime and crime boss in Boston's lucrative underworld.

programme.title: The Life With Larry Mazza
programme.desc: Former Colombo crime family enforcer Larry Mazza interviews JoAnn "Joie Miami" Gallo, whose role in the Mafia grew into a liaison with Santo Trafficante, one of the most powerful Mafia bosses in the United States.

programme.title: The Life With Larry Mazza
programme.desc: Former Colombo crime family enforcer Larry Mazza interviews Steve Crespi, a drug dealer, bouncer and security man for Rick Rizzolo's Las Vegas gentlemen's club the Crazy Horse Too.

programme.title: The Life With Larry Mazza
programme.desc: Former Colombo crime family enforcer Larry Mazza interviews Frank "Frankie Steel" Pontillo, a Colombo associate who was best known for dressing up like a Hasidic Jew to kill a rival member of the Orena faction.

programme.title: The Life With Larry Mazza
programme.desc: After serving a 10-year sentence, Larry goes on to write a book called The Life in which he pulls back the curtain on the hidden world of La Cosa Nostra; Larry exposes the criminal society of the New York mafia.

programme.title: The Life With Larry Mazza
programme.desc: After serving a 10-year sentence, Larry goes on to write a book called The Life in which he pulls back the curtain on the hidden world of La Cosa Nostra; Larry exposes the criminal society of the New York mafia.

programme.title: The Life With Larry Mazza
programme.desc: Larry Mazza interviews Anthony Ruggiano Jr, whose father was a Gambino soldier dating back to Albert Anastasia; Anthony Jr. ran a crew under John Gotti out of Queens, N.Y.

programme.title: The Life With Larry Mazza
programme.desc: Larry Mazza interviews John Alite, former enforcer for the Gambino family and John Gotti Jr.'s best friend; he joined the Albanian mafia at a young age and took part in dozens of murders -- many of them as the shooter.

programme.title: The Life With Larry Mazza
programme.desc: Larry Mazza interviews Dave Iacovelli, son of Fat Dave Iacovelli, capo in the Gambino family; his memories of his mom and dad put him with Frank Sinatra and the Rat Pack.

programme.title: Mill of the Stone Women
programme.desc: An art student (Pierre Brice) in 1912 Holland finds posed statues are petrified corpses drained by a madman (Wolfgang Preiss).

programme.title: Freaks
programme.desc: Sideshow performers punish acrobat Cleopatra (Olga Baclanova) for humiliating their friend, tiny Hans.

programme.title: Alice, Sweet Alice
programme.desc: Suspicion falls on 12-year-old Alice (Paula E. Sheppard) for killing her sister (Brooke Shields) and others with a butcher knife.

programme.title: The Mysterious Mr. M
programme.desc: A federal agent must stop an evil scientist from deploying a drug that will enable him to steal submarine parts.

programme.title: Dr. Terror's House of Horrors
programme.desc: A traveler's (Peter Cushing) tarot cards tell how an architect, musician, doctor (Donald Sutherland), gardener and critic (Christopher Lee) will die.

programme.title: Carnival of Souls
programme.desc: After taking a job as a church organist, the sole survivor of a fatal car crash encounters phantoms that lure her to a deserted carnival outside of town.

programme.title: The Curse of Frankenstein
programme.desc: The condemned baron (Peter Cushing) recalls making a mute monster (Christopher Lee) in his own image.

programme.title: H.G. Wells' Invisible Man
programme.desc: After agreeing to help a foreign refugees organization, Peter Brady is caught in an elaborate scheme to capture the Invisible Man.

programme.title: Queen of Blood
programme.desc: Astronauts (John Saxon, Basil Rathbone, Judi Meredith) go to Mars and return with a green vampire woman.
